parameters.definition: Number of gifts delivered by the new company per trip
Number of gifts delivered by the old company per trip
Amount of diesel used by the new company per trip
Amount of diesel used by the old company per trip
Minimum total number of gifts that need to be delivered
Maximum number of trips the new company can make
Minimum percentage of all trips that must be made by the old company

description: A toy store decides to deliver gifts using two shipping companies, a new one and an old one. The new company can deliver \param{GiftsNew} gifts per trip while the old company can deliver \param{GiftsOld} gifts per trip. The new company uses \param{DieselNew} liters of diesel per trip while the old company uses \param{DieselOld} liters of diesel per trip. The toy store needs to deliver at least \param{MinGifts} gifts. There can be at most \param{MaxTripsNew} trips made by the new company. In order to make sure that the old company does not go out of business, at least \param{MinPercentOld} of all trips must be made by the old company. How many trips should each company make to minimize the total amount of diesel used?
